topic.title: License audit
topic.p: To be able to conform with licenses of your project dependencies, you will need to explore the licenses such dependencies are licenses under, and make sure that the license of your project completely conforms with them.
The %feature% feature employs the SPDX License List and provides the following features for inspecting compatibility of your project dependencies:

list.li: Inspect license compatibility between your project and project dependencies
Override specified licenses in the license matrix
Create customer dependencies for including them into the %product% report

topic.p: Currently, the %feature% feature supports the JPS, Maven, Gradle, npm, yarn and composer projects.

This feature is included in all existing %product% linters, so no installation steps are required. All configuration is carried out using the qodana.yaml file. To enable the License audit feature, add these lines to qodana.yaml:
Run %product% using your linter. For example, it can be the universal
Open the %product% report and click the Project audit tab to see more information about license audit results.

The License rules tab contains the table of license correspondence. The Project license column lists license names, while the Allowed licenses and the Prohibited licenses columns list the licenses that are compatible and incompatible with the license respectively. This can be helpful when you need to override licenses.
